unnormalised: Yeah, so I was using VS Code for a while, right? But then my friend Ravi told me to try out IntelliJ IDEA. He's like, "Bro, seriously, IntelliJ is much better for Java dev." I was hesitant 'cause I'd already customized VS Code with a bunch of extensions, like ESLint and Prettier. But I gave it a shot. Honestly, the autocomplete in IntelliJ is miles ahead. Plus, the built-in debugger is just *chef's kiss*. It did cost â‚¹21,900 for the ultimate edition though, which is quite a bit more than free VS Code. Now I mostly use IntelliJ for backend and VS Code for frontend, like when I'm messing with React and Node.js.
normalised: Yeah, so I was using V-S Code for a while, right? But then my friend Ravi told me to try out IntelliJ I-D-E-A. He's like, "Bro, seriously, IntelliJ is much better for Java dev." I was hesitant 'cause I'd already customized V-S Code with a bunch of extensions, like E-S-Lint and Prettier. But I gave it a shot. Honestly, the autocomplete in IntelliJ is miles ahead. Plus, the built-in debugger is just chef's kiss. It did cost rupee twenty one thousand nine hundred for the ultimate edition though, which is quite a bit more than free V-S Code. Now I mostly use IntelliJ for backend and V-S Code for frontend, like when I'm messing with React and Node.js.
